result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. James L. Caufman

records.addlTxt: 2:00 PM Cases called: 21CF1354, 22CF29 and 22CF1055. Defendant James L. Caufman not in court.  Attorney Robert Allen Thorson in court for James L. Caufman.  Attorney Afton Lewis in court for State of Wisconsin. This is the date and time set for a status conference. Attorney Thorson notified his client of todays hearing. Warrants are issued in each case.
Status conference on October 24, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

(11:25 AM cases 21CF1354, 22CF29, 22CF1055 called.) Defendant James L. Caufman in court. Attorney Robert Allen Thorson in court for James L. Caufman. Prosecuting attorney Tiffany M. Winter in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Court orders the warrants are quashed.
Attorney Thorson advises will need time to see if the defendant is willing to accept the offer and will need to complete plea paperwork if the defendant is willing to accept the offer.
Court advises the defendant this is last warning for non-appearances.
Status Conference in cases 21CF1354, 22CF29 and Hearing in case 22CF1055 scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 2 pm in person.

(11:00 AM cases 21CF1354, 22CF29, 22CF1055 called.) Defendant James L. Caufman does not appear in court or via Zoom. Attorney Robert Allen Thorson in court for James L. Caufman. Prosecuting attorney Tiffany M. Winter in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
State in compliance with victim notification requirements. 
Attorney Thorson has no information for the defendant's non-appearance as the defendant was aware of today's date and time.
Attorney Thorson advises has attempted contact with no luck.
Court orders warrants noting the defendant was present in court when today's date and time was set.
Status conference on October 13, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Cases called at 10:28 AM: 21CF1354, 22CF29.
Defendant James L. Caufman in court with Attorney Robert Thoron. Attorney Tiffany Winter appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin.
State in compliance with victim notification requirements. Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties. 
Defendant waives reading of Information and enters Not Guilty pleas. 
Attorney Thorson requests a STC one month out.
STC: 10/13/22 at 11:00 AM (in person).
Arraignment on September 8, 2022 at 10:30 am.

8:53 AM cases 21CF1354, 22CF29 called. Prosecuting attorney Andrew James Gunderson in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant James L. Caufman in court, in custody. Attorney Robert Allen Thorson not in court. 
State requests a cash bond. Court reinstates previous bond and advises the defendant if they do not appear at the next court date, a large cash bond will be ordered. 
An arraignment is scheduled for 9-8-22 at 10:30 AM (in person, 30 min).

(Cases 21CF1354, 22CF29 are called at 3:00 PM) Defendant James L. Caufman not in court.  Attorney Robert Allen Thorson in court for James L. Caufman.  Attorney Matthew Kirkpatrick in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney has no information for the Court as to the Defendant's non-appearance. State requests warrant. 
Warrant ordered.
Arraignment on July 25, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Same as Complaint

(Cases called at 1:54 PM  - 21CF1354 and 22CF29)
Defendant James L. Caufman in court with Attorney Robert Allen Thorson.  Attorney Andrew James Gunderson in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing in both cases - waiver accepted by Court.  Any authorized warrants are quashed.  Cases referred to Branch 3 for further scheduling.
Hearing on July 5, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

3:36 PM Cases called: 21CF1354 & 22CF29. Defendant James L. Caufman not in court.  Attorney Robert Allen Thorson in court for James L. Caufman. Attorney Matthew Kirkpatrick appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 

State's witness (Officer Adam Phillips) appears via Zoom and is prepared to testify. 

Warrant ordered on both cases, but stayed until July 5th at noon.

Order on Request to Appear Remotely
The Court Orders: Adam Philips may appear remotely for the proceeding scheduled on 07/12/2022 at 1:30 p.m.
Proposed Order on Request to Appear Remotely
to Appear Remotely
Preliminary hearing on July 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

(Cases 21CF1354, 22CF29 are called at 10:15 AM) Prosecuting attorney Kelly Ronquist in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant James L. Caufman in court.  Attorney Robert Allen Thorson in court for James L. Caufman. 
Defense indicates no agreement- requests cases be set for Preliminary Hearing. 
Preliminary Hearing: 07/12/2022 at 1:30 PM.

10:06 AM Cases called; 21CF919 & 21CF1354. Prosecuting attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant James L. Caufman in court.  Attorney Robert Allen Thorson in court for James L. Caufman. PTC: 05/09/22 at 2:45pm. Fingerprints to be completed today.
Hearing scheduled for May 31, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Hearing on May 31, 2022 at 09:30 am.

(9:55 AM cases 21CF1354, 22CF29 called.) Prosecuting attorney Monica A Fallon appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant James L. Caufman appeared in court. Attorney Robert Allen Thorson appeared by video for James L. Caufman. 
Attorney Thorson advises was just appointed and requests new dates.
Pre-Trial Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on March 9, 2022 at 3:30 pm.
Hearing scheduled for April 5, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Hearing on April 5, 2022 at 09:30 am.

records.addlTxt: Attorney Robert Thorson - at $100/hr.  Defendant shall reimburse Eau Claire County by making payments of $100.00 beginning 03/04/2022 and every 30 days thereafter.  Payment shall not exceed the full cost of representation.

records.addlTxt: Hearing on February 23, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Cases called at 11:24 AM: 21CF1354, 22CF29.
Defendant James L. Caufman appeared in custody via video conference from the jail with Attorney Sonia Anderson. Attorney Afton Brianna Lewis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Warrants quashed. Defendant waives reading of Complaints.   Time limits for preliminary hearing waived.  
Pre-Trial Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on 1/26/22 at 3:15 PM.
RTN: 2/23/22 at 9:30 AM.

Conditions:
No contact with anyone involved in illegal drug activities unless in a therapeutic setting.
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety.
Defendant not to consume/use/possess any illegal drugs/non-prescribed drugs or drug paraphernalia.
Comply with sex offender registry.
Comply with Pre-Trial Monitoring Services with possible drug testing.
(Covers 21CF1354 and 22CF29)
